In ancient Rome, Julius Caesar was indeed born via caesarean section, lending his name to the surgical procedure. His mother miraculously survived the operation, defying the common outcome of the procedure at the time.

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
Was Julius Caesar born via caesarean section?
Where is this information from?
ENDINSTRUCTION

Yes, according to the information provided in the BBC News Magazine article from 2011, Julius Caesar was born via caesarean section, and his mother survived the procedure, which was unusual for that time period.

Reference:

BBC News Magazine. (2011). [Article on Julius Caesar's birth]. Retrieved from https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-14779271
